Reviews.Title: LG Rumor Reflex Is Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Gearz
Reviews.Content: I got three of these phones when i renewed my cell contract. The sound quality is excellent and the pop up bubble is great when i get a message. The phone is easy to use but has some bad points. The worst part is the qwerty board is silver with blue back lighted buttons and it is very hard to see unless the room is dark. The phone is very slippery and will slide out of your hand or off a table or dash if your not careful. The power button is on the top instead of the side so it makes it difficult for one handed operation. I got the phones for free with a two year contract so I have to keep them but if I had to pay for them I would be disappointed. The only other thing that is a problem is the quick (Hello) feature is not that quick because you have to hit three buttons after the phone is on to call that person. One more thing,when you take pictures the screen is off set so to center it can be a pain and takes some practice.

Reviews.Title: Just the phone I needed!
Reviews.Author: iconicdave
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new cell phone cause the one I had was old and the buttons were fading so some of the buttons I couldn't even see what it was. The LG Rumor Reflex was the perfect upgrade. My old phone had a QWERTY keyboard but the new phone has a sweet full keyboard that slid down. The LG also has a beatufiul touch screen. This phone is very functional at the same time it still works very well as cellphone.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Ciara
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase! I really like the phone, and everything about it. The only downfall is that the space bar is a little stiff and takes some effort to press down on for it to become effective. Other than that, it's a great phone! I really suggest it, and it's worth the price! I was very impressed. (:

Reviews.Title: The little phone that can
Reviews.Author: Little Miss Pretty Penny
Reviews.Content: Do you remember the girl in high school that didn't have the budget, or the looks, or the accessories (car) to hang with the cool kids, but instead of fading into the background, she somehow was able to hold her own with those kids? She was "in" because she knew who she was and they knew she just did things a little differently. That is kind of how the Rumor Reflex is, and kind of how the users of this phone have to be: The Reflex is not a smart phone, and let's face it: we all want a smartphone, but I can't justify the pretty penny those contracts cost every month, not to mention the cost of the actual phone that everyone drops and cracks! But if you accept the Rumor Reflex with the understanding that you are going to have to scroll through menus to get to things, and that for everything you want to do, except make a call, you begin with the main menu, I think you will be very happy and, dare I say, yes I dare! Impressed. So: specifics: I realized that all I really want from my cell phone is to 1) be able to text (keyboard: check! Yeah, the face is light-colored with a blue back light, and yeah, the keys stick a little at first, but you get used to it. Also, if you add a plastic protective cover, for some reason this makes the keyboard slide better and makes the entire phone more substantial.) 2)  a camera for fun things I see and want to text to friends or post to facebook (check! But it is only 2 megapixels so isn't great quality, but it is good enough. Also, for some reason the menu for the camera is on the viewfinder and covers part of the image you are composing which is annoying and takes a while to ignore. There also is a camcorder, but practice with it because you need to verify the sound is recording.) and 3) I want to get my e-mails when I'm away from a computer. So this leaves the web, and this will be the biggest disappointment for those who compare this to a smartphone because the Reflex will fall short. The main word here is slow, and I don't mind slow at all, but this redefines slow.  You'll get your e-mail, and you'll be able to respond to them on the pullout keyboard, but you will get them several minutes after you'd get them on a computer or tablet. This isn't just a function of the provider, but it is the phone, going through all those menus, step-by-step.  It isn't smart and accessing the web is going to make this obvious. My e-mails aren't time-sensitive, so I am perfectly happy to pocket the $50 a month I save on my plan, (that is $600 a year, and THAT is a pretty penny) and deal with slow. There are also very few apps that I need on my phone. But you still can have some fun with personalized rings, and alarms and you can even watch You Tube videos and Google those trivia questions if you want. Now: Have you noticed what I didn't mention? talking on the phone. I realized I don't use my cell much for calls. The sound quality is good, and there is a speaker phone that works great, but I prefer text to talk. So all in all, Little Miss Pretty Penny rates the Reflex a solid four stars: It thinks it can, and it can!

Reviews.Title: rumor reflex is great
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: was very pleased with the reflex when i got it. its very stylish and easy to use, was way better then what i expected....it may not be a smartphone, but it works great, love the smooth feel of the phone and its lightweight....very pleased with my product thank you

Reviews.Title: Worst Phone I Have Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: Susannah Book Buyer
Reviews.Content: This phone is so utterly useless that I am returning it in less than a week.  The keyboard slides out on the left, not the right like most phones.  Its touch screen is hyper sensitive, so much so that you can't hold the phone with your cheek.  Even when holding it with my hands, buttons get pressed.  It drops calls within 30 seconds.  It is so horrible that I'm not even able to hold a signal long enough to call the phone company to return it.  I had to go to work and use that phone.  The pop up bubbles are very hard to press, unless your finger tip is the size of a pin head.  This phone is GARBAGE!  Don't waste your time or your money with it!!

Reviews.Title: dont buy
Reviews.Author: amanda
Reviews.Content: Dont buy this phone the one I received don't work and I have tryed everything to get it working even took it to the boost store and they said there's nothing they can do it was a waste of money

Reviews.Title: Beware Software Malfunction
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for about 45 days (of course outside the 30 day return window) and I had a software problem so the phone had to be sent back to LG.  I was told by a tech at the Sprint store that this is a known issue.  Quite a pain to be without my phone for two weeks.  I would not recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Good thing it was free
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Horne
Reviews.Content: I am amazed as how useless this phone can be sometimes.It comes with a "social networking" app, but with something as easy as the camera, you can not turn off the camera shutter sound!The phone slides the wrong way, so you have to use your left hand, or slide it upside down and then flip it back over.Call me old, but I like physical buttons. They are always there.  With this phone if you need to enter a pin to retrieve voicemails you have to unlock the keypad first. Not hard, but massively annoying.They redesigned the whole idea of a home screen so now you can't have a simple clock and calender, also massively annoying. And there are no hot keys or quick alarms anymore.I would not recommend this phone!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: SeaWA
Reviews.Content: I've had the phone for 10 months and am considering replacing it as it can be such a pain.  Sometimes calls don't hang up.  Sometimes it calls the last caller for no apparent reason.  The touchscreen can be unresponsive.  The keypad can be activated if your ear comes in contact with the touchscreen during a call.  Poor call quality (I've heard my own voice message on the other end).  Lots of little annoyances that add up to disappointment.  Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Tanya Brewer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone a few days ago, delivery was pretty quick and set up was easy, that's about all the positive feedback I have! This phone is a nightmare to answer if you have any length fingernails. I read some reviews where people were complaining about the keyboard, but I didn't have any issues with it. The touch screen is great if you only use the pads of your finger tips, photo quality is terrible and downloads for some strange reason are unable to be completed. I have already ordered another phone and will be returning this one.

Reviews.Title: anoying smart phone
Reviews.Author: Allen T. Redd
Reviews.Content: Hare to navigate menus and the buttons fo for the text even though they light up in the dark are still too small to read and saving and editing phone numbers is a very hard issue to do. There is no option to edit the spelling once you lock it in your have to save it again and start over.

Reviews.Title: Awful Awful Awful
Reviews.Author: Sweet Lena
Reviews.Content: There was nothing good about this phone. Lg truly disappointed me.  I had boost service for a very long time. I was hoping to upgrade phones.  This phone was terrible with everything including signal.  I can say Amazon was amazing with the exchange and hearing my concerns.  I truly enjoy shopping at Amazon because of their wonderful customer service.  I ended up buying a HTC ONE V with virgin mobile service.  I am very happy I went that direction.

Reviews.Title: surprise
Reviews.Author: Delois Sheppared
Reviews.Content: The phone that arrived looked and was different from the shown for sell.Lucky it was a Chirstmas present and my daughter had know ideal.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy This Phone!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: When I first got it it wouldn't start, at all! It charged, but that its. I looked online on how to complete restart the thing and it worked, but after a few weeks, my phone froze, then wouldn't turn on again. Just charge. So I tried restarting it again by draining the battery out, then pressing the power button while connecting it, like last time. This time, it didn't change anything and my phone STILL wont turn on. I looked online and apparently it's a very common problem with this phone, I wish I would've done research before purchasing it. I've contacted the seller, but have yet to get a response, so I'll probably shoot them another message. Very very bad phone, DON'T BUY IT.

Reviews.Title: Not applicable
Reviews.Author: Susan Reichard
Reviews.Content: Couldn't even use it as I am under contract to Sprint. What a laugh when I found out that Sprint owns Boost!

Reviews.Title: Great replacement
Reviews.Author: nolimit06
Reviews.Content: I need a simple replacement phone that did the functions of the newer smart phones. I've had no problems with this phone and the fast shipping to my residence made this buy a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: The Worst Cell Phone I Have Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: The Rifleman
Reviews.Content: Although LG has some great products, this definitely is NOT one of them! This phone is very hard to navigate, and near impossible to download any Apps for it. When using it on the web, it is very slow and unreliable. The "slide to unlock" feature is a constant annoyance! On the bright side, this is a good looking phone, and light weight, but that's about where anything really good about this phone ends.

Reviews.Title: LG Rumor
Reviews.Author: Janice Russell
Reviews.Content: The LG Rumor phone is a nice phone but it is so hard to see the keyboard in light. I also had a very hard time downloading music to the phone and eventually it stored as a mass storage and not in the music file!  I will primarily use this phone for basic talk and text because the screen is too small for much else.

Reviews.Title: LG Rumor was a great purchase
Reviews.Author: Brandon Childers "b. Childers"
Reviews.Content: I am very delighted with my purchase. The shipment was fast and the product met my expectations and more. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: misleading
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Parcheta
Reviews.Content: I actually liked the phone a lot, but i did not realize that Boost mobile is incompatible with sprint.  it was a shame to have to send it back.  I found this phone on a search for sprint compatible phones...  so i felt the advertisement was misleading.

Reviews.Title: The only thing worse is Credo Mobile
Reviews.Author: G. Richardson
Reviews.Content: This is far and away the worst cell phone I've used. The keyboard is virtually impossible to read in most light conditions because it's silver AND reflective, with pale blue backlighting. It requires all manner of contortions to make keys visible. The keyboard is sluggish in responses, especially the space bar, and don't let your charger get too far away because battery life is the worst I've encountered. After a few months use, it's sometimes necessary to restart the phone to get the home menu and call buttons to respond. Indeed, the only thing worse than this phone is the Credo Mobile service through which I got it. When I complained and wanted to exchange it for something that worked, Credo offered six choices: a REFURBISHED LG Reflex like I had OR one of five smart phones, each of which requires unlimited data service and hundreds of dollars is extra yearly expenses. That's all we have in our inventory, Credo's rep explained. Fine, I responded, I'll just send these back, reactivate my old phones and then renew my contract when I can have a choice. No, no, said the rep. That contract is binding, no matter what you do about your phones; send back those phones and you'll have a 2-year contract and no new phone of any sort. After arguing with her and getting nowhere, I decided to fight another day ... and then got the same runaround when I called back. Then a friend telephoned to say they were going to switch to Credo as I had urged many friends. My response: DON'T DO IT. I had encouraged many friends to join Credo because they market themselves as the nation's only politically progressive (liberal) phone company -- good guys who donate 1 percent of revenues to liberal interest groups and causes. But that's just a cheap marketing ploy from what, in reality, is just another sleazy company. One percent? Peanuts compared to other corporations' giving programs. And Credo service costs more. Oh, and if Credo had offered a working phone to swap for the Reflex, there would have been a hefty restocking fee. So stay away from this phone and Credo Mobile. I apologized to the friends I'd urged to switch, and I tell the same any time cell services are mentioned. Credo's marketing ploy is a good one, but it's a ploy. Cheaper cell providers will enable folks to use those savings to make appreciably larger contributions to worthy causes -- and avoid disasters like the Rumor Reflex.

Reviews.Title: This phone sucks
Reviews.Author: Deric
Reviews.Content: We got four phones when we renewed our contract. The problem is we have two lines. 2 of the 4 phone's microphones went out and we had to replace the entire phone. Stay far far away unless you have a very annoying voice you don't want anyone to hear.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Bria Hopkins
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for about a month now and I love it. So far it is a really nice phone. I love the touch screen and slide out keyboard. Sometimes the screen turns off randomly but I just turn the phone off and then back on and no problems. I love this phone everybody seems to notice it too.

Reviews.Title: Ok but not for me
Reviews.Author: Amada
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone and the keyboard was too small had to return it i dont know if i would reccomend this phone to anyone probably not

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS PHONE !!! THIS IS NOT AN ANDROID.
Reviews.Author: arita
Reviews.Content: I REALY DO NOT LIK E THIS PHONE. FOR ONE IT CANNOT CONNECT TO WIFI NETWORKS OR APP STORE.  ALSO THE GRAPHICS SUCK. I JUST TOOK IT OUT OF AND PUT THE BATTERIES IN , AND I CAN SEE THIS WAS A MISTAKE, AND I WAITED FOR IT. IT WAS SUPPOSE TO BE DELIVERD ON THE  29TH. BUT I JUST GOT TODAY THE 3RD. DISSAPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: rumor
Reviews.Author: CONNIE FROM 3 RIVERS MI
Reviews.Content: this phone is very cute and stylish, but i get no signal at all unless i go uptown, so its not worth the money unless your going for looks, i dont like it, no signal, i cant use it..

Reviews.Title: Loved it!
Reviews.Author: Luisa
Reviews.Content: I conceder this phone  was a good buy. I will recomend it to anyone. Deal was good. I gave it a five because it is a great phone.

Reviews.Title: my new phone
Reviews.Author: Linda Pesqueira
Reviews.Content: my son wanted my to upgrade my old phone i didn't want something fancy, just happy with my new phone even though he has to help me with it sometimes

Reviews.Title: cant wait for this
Reviews.Author: judys money
Reviews.Content: I have looked up this phone for days and I cant wait to get it and use it..i am looking forward to all the features of this phone and I like the looks of the phone..

Reviews.Title: It came in a nice box
Reviews.Author: jessica owens
Reviews.Content: it came in a nice box i have not tried it due to it being a gift but im sure it will be great!

ProductInfo.Features:
Affordable no-contract phone from Boost Mobile for on-the-go voice and text communications
Choose from Monthly Unlimited or $2 Daily Unlimited plans with unlimited talk, text, e-mail, and web
3-inch touchscreen with a fully slide-out QWERTY keyboard
Keep in touch with email (Yahoo, Gmail, Hotmail) and easy access to Facebook and Twitter
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, USB cable, activation kit, and user guide
ProductInfo.Name: LG Rumor Reflex Phone (Boost Mobile)
